results.title: A Great ship
results.creator_credit: John Reeve, Anthony Gilkison, British Information Services and Rayant Pictures
results.brief_description: P&O decided in 1955 to build the largest passenger liner since World War II, the Canberra. This documentary focuses on the construction of the vessel, followed by her maiden voyage.

results.title: A Great day to go
results.creator_credit: Hugh Macdonald, Ronald Bowie and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: A variety of people are shown enjoying water activities, e.g. surfing, boating, fishing. Through their thoughtlessness, tragedies occur in the water. Produced for the New Zealand National Water Safety Council.

results.title: A Grain of sand
results.creator_credit: David Keith Hardy, John Luck and UNICEF
results.brief_description: Firstly children’s needs are dramatised through a poem by William Blake and drawings by Ronald Searle. Then we follow a 10 year old Tunisian Arab boy to a health clinic, a school and a vocational training centre - three concrete ways to help meet children’s needs.

results.title: A Gourmet tour. - Volume 1.
results.creator_credit: Gian Manara and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description: The last decade has seen the emergence of an exciting and unique cuisine in Australia, arising from the multi-cultural nature of our society and the abundance of fresh, natural ingredients. This program is a gourmet’s tour of some of the best restaurants in the forefront of this development. It profiles the style of these famous restaurants, their chefs and details how to prepare some of their favourite dishes. Divided into three sections: Dining in Sydney and Dining with wine. Restaurants include Cleopatra’s, The Cellar, Berowra Waters, Taylors, Bangkok, The Barn, Cotswold House and Craigmoor.

results.title: A Good catch: a film about modern fishing nets and lines
results.brief_description: Shows a new British development in fishing equipment, the use of high density polyethylene as a material for fishing nets and lines. It shows conversion into filament, the weaving of the net and the use of this type of net and line. The fishing scenes were shot off Aslesund, Norway and north of the Arctic Circle in the Lofoten Islands.
results.title_for_label: A Good catch: a film about modern fishing nets and lines

results.title: A Good beginning
results.creator_credit: Norwood Studios and Modern Management Films
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the right way to induct and train employees on new jobs. Seen through the eyes of a young girl hired to learn a data processing card-punch operation. Compares correct techniques with wrong techniques. Reminds supervisors of the need to relieve tensions in the new employee before useful training can begin.

results.title: A Goal to win
results.brief_description: A must for every school and netball club. “A Goal to Win” is unique in its concept as a training video. Some of the exciting aspects covered are: Concentration, Individual Fitness, Team Cohesion, Self-Discipline, Team Tactics, Individual Skills, Motivation and Training Routines. The video traces players from beginners to elite players.

results.title: A Global family
results.brief_description: Suzanne reflects on the impacts of her HIV diagnosis and in particular coming to terms with the fact that her dream to have children would not be realised in the way that she first imagined.

results.title: A Glittering song
results.creator_credit: Short Film Studio and Praha Loutkovy Film
results.brief_description: An animated children’s film in which bits of coloured glass and graphic art appear, change, and shift in an endless variety of patterns. This live action documentary technique creates a fantasy world of colour, light and form with a slight thread of story involving a child.
